result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  court costs, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge to be paid by 5/14/2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
*No drivers license suspension.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to count one.  
*AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  Sentence to be served in Wisconsin State Prison system.

records.addlTxt: Order DENYING Decision and Order Denyin Motion For Order signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Defendant's pro se motion to order DOC to vacate the domestic violence counseling.
Original SENTENCING Transcript (17 pages) commencing MAY 13, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
This matter was put over from 5/13/2015.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  This sentence is to be served in the Wisconsin State prison system.
AS TO COUNT 2:
 The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 0 days time served.  This sentence is to be served in the Wisconsin State prison system.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges (both counts) are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/14/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/14/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.

Pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered "Repeater" enhancers on both counts dismissed.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 4/16/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in custody.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Stephann A Bonds-Shaw in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
